ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: but the most miserable will shun it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Only the wretch will turn aside,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: but the wretched will turn away from it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: but the reprobates will turn away
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the most wicked will stay away from it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But it will be avoided by the wretched,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the most unfortunate one will avoid it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: but the most wretched shall flout it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But the most hapless will flout it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but it will be ignored by the most unfortunate,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and the most wretched will shun it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But it will be avoided by those most unfortunate ones,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But it will be avoided by the wretched,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: but the most wretched shall avoid it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But the wretched will avoid it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But the wretched one will avoid it -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [87:11] but the wretched one (al-ashqā means al-shaqī), that is to say, the disbeliever, will shun it, that is, the reminder, in other words, he will leave it aside, not looking at it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But the most hapless) the damned, as it is in Allah's foreknowledge, (will flout it) will steer away and avoid taking admonition by means of the Qur'an or through Allah,
